image.altText: Trump Harris composite

props.synopsis: America's economy is booming but everyday life is much more expensive than it was four years ago — and that is the one question that's leading some voters to vote for Donald Trump.

title.children: The rising problem fuelling support for Trump hours ahead of the US election

image.altText: An assembled 3D printed gun. Parts have been printed in blue, orange and black filament.

props.synopsis: A record number of illegal 3D-printed guns have been seized across every state and territory. Police warn these firearms are lethal and those found with the blueprints to make them could face years in jail.

title.children: 3D-printed guns look like children's toys. They're lethal and on the rise

image.altText: William Tyrrell smiling holding a cup with Lady Justice behind

props.synopsis: Any evidence police have gathered against William Tyrrell's foster mother will finally be presented to a coroner as the inquest into the toddler's disappearance resumes this week.

title.children: William Tyrrell inquest resumes with new details of police theory about involvement of former foster mother

image.altText: Brothers Dru and Nathan Baggaley who have been convicted over a cocaine smuggling plot

props.synopsis: Nathan and Dru Baggaley, who tried to smuggle hundreds of kilograms of cocaine into Australia, have been sentenced a second time after negotiating "very significantly different" circumstances about their offending.

title.children: Olympic kayaker and brother have jail sentences reduced for failed $200m cocaine smuggling plot

image.altText: A black ROG Phone 5 Android mobile phone screen featuring a round, purple star image

props.synopsis: Australians using 4G- or 5G-compatible phones say telcos and retailers are not doing enough to protect them from being left without critical access to mobile networks.

title.children: Australia's 3G network has shut down, so why are 4G and 5G users being cut off?

image.altText: Quincy Jones smiling, wearing sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Jones's historic career ranged from producing Michael Jackson's record-setting Thriller to prize-winning film and television scores and collaborations with Frank Sinatra and Ray Charles.

title.children: Quincy Jones, music titan who worked with everyone from Frank Sinatra to Michael Jackson, dies at 91

image.altText: A group of people walking down the stairs leaving a court house.

props.synopsis: The owners of the childcare centre charged for leaving a child trapped on a bus for 6 hours in May 2022 have been fined in court.

title.children: Childcare company found guilty after toddler left on hot bus for 6 hours

image.altText: Six people stand behind one man who is speaking at a podium in a suit

props.synopsis: A highly vaunted push to "rapidly" develop disruptive military technologies into the Australian Defence Force is facing uncertainty, with local companies saying an initial project has been "cancelled".

title.children: Australian companies furious after advanced defence technology project 'cancelled'

image.altText: A composite image of five people, four men and a woman. Their faces are in boxes.

props.synopsis: These insiders and whistleblowers are troubled by the risks of disinformation, threats to democracy and extreme dangers for young people.

title.children: One by one, these insiders left the world's biggest social media companies. They warn safeguards have been 'cut to the bone'

image.altText: Jaala Hinchcliffe giving evidence at Senate estimates.

props.synopsis: The acting boss of the Department of Parliamentary Services says she is unable to say when the secretary, who is currently on extended paid leave, would return to work.

title.children: Senators grill acting Parliament House boss over secretary's absence, lucrative payment and corruption raids

image.altText: An image of a night sky, lit up by a meteor.

props.synopsis: It will be best viewed late into the evening and early tomorrow morning, but unless you're a night sky enthusiast, then it might not be worth your time.

title.children: Tonight's meteor shower is known for producing very bright fireballs — and you can see it anywhere in Australia

image.altText: rocket in vertical position at night

props.synopsis: Australia's first commercial orbital rocket launch may be as early as next month after a "long, painful journey" to get a permit to launch.

title.children: Gilmour Space Technologies given green light to launch Australia's first commercial orbital rocket

image.altText: A silhouette shows graduate students wearing gowns and hats.

props.synopsis: Economists have welcomed the government's plan to raise the level of income people need to earn before they need to make student debt repayments, but argue that reducing the cost of higher education would have greater benefits than slashing existing debts.

title.children: Government's plan to overhaul student debt repayments receives mixed reception from economists

image.altText: Leigh Haussen practices his bounce before and AFL match in the centre of the field

props.synopsis: AFL field umpire Leigh Haussen will not be eligible to officiate the first round of the 2025 AFL season after he dressed as Osama bin Laden at an end of season event.

title.children: AFL umpire banned for 'inappropriate' costume at end of season event

image.altText: A woman and a girl in a hospital hallway with their faces blurred out.

props.synopsis: The WA court hears a teenager spoke of not having her own voice when hospital workers asked her to use it, and her father did not want her using a feeding tube.

title.children: Girl allegedly starved by parents told hospital carers she 'never had a voice'

image.altText: An image of Chris Ellison superimposed on an image of his mining operations

props.synopsis: The managing director of a major lithium and iron ore company in WA is accused of tax evasion involving offshore companies.

title.children: Mining magnate Chris Ellison to step down over alleged tax evasion

image.altText: Man in khaki and wide brim hat stands in front of a group of donkeys

props.synopsis: Chris Henggeler is the only grazier in Australia using feral donkeys to regenerate his remote property. Now he's on the wrong side of the law.

title.children: 'He has transformed a desert into an oasis': The defiant grazier running a radical regeneration experiment using feral donkeys

image.altText: Eric Idle, a man in his 80s, wears a tuxedo on a red carpet, with a blue media wall behind him.

props.synopsis: Eric Idle, one-sixth of legendary comedy group Monty Python, brings his new live show, Always Look on the Bright Side of Life, Live!, to Australia this month.

title.children: Eric Idle is proud to be behind one of England's top funeral songs. But it came from desperation

image.altText: A selfie of a man.

props.synopsis: Cain Dion Sturdy, 37, has been sentenced to six years after pleading guilty to armed robbery with violence, break and enter while armed, and unlawful use of a motor vehicle in the District Court in Ipswich on Monday.

title.children: Serial home invader loses finger after being bitten by victim in his latest attack on Ipswich couple

image.altText: A Surf Life Saving rescuer pushing a jetski into the water off the beach.

props.synopsis: The boy was trying to cross a channel of water on the NSW Central Coast with his father and brothers when the current swept him away.

title.children: Search resumes for missing 11yo boy swept out to sea at 'dangerous' channel

image.altText: pat cummins

props.synopsis: Australia gets its summer of cricket off to a winning start, claiming a victory in the first of a three-game ODI series against Pakistan at the MCG.

title.children: Australia claim victory over Pakistan at MCG

image.altText: Amrita facing away from the camera

props.synopsis: When Amrita moved to Australia with her husband he was "very gentle", but soon after his family was treating her like a servant. New laws are set to finally recognise dowry abuse as a form of domestic violence to help those in similar situations.

title.children: 'Daylight robbery' of dowry abuse leaving women stranded, but new laws offer hope

image.altText: Maya Rudolph and Kamala Harris

props.synopsis: For 50 years, Saturday Night Live has been at the forefront of US political satire. Here are some of the politicians, presidents and White House hopefuls who have made an appearance.

title.children: Kamala Harris joins line of US politicians appearing on Saturday Night Live

image.altText: a man smiling sitting next to a woman wearing a wedding dress

props.synopsis: Jordan Fineanganofo, 23, pleaded not guilty to six charges including the murder of paramedic Steven Tougher outside a Campbelltown McDonald's in April 2023. Mr Tougher's family wept in a Sydney courtroom while hearing graphic details of the stabbing attack.

title.children: Man charged with murder of paramedic could be found not criminally responsible, court hears

image.altText: a man's silhouette

props.synopsis: He decided tough, decisive and quick action was needed.

title.children: After his son was bullied, this father took out a personal protection order against the teenage perpetrator

image.altText: Man sits in front of trees being interviewed on camera by journalist

props.synopsis: For weeks, senior Larrakia traditional owner Richard Fejo had been wrestling with the impact of Northern Territory laws targeting youth crime. Now he says he is taking a stand.

title.children: Traditional owner quits public role over NT law reducing age of criminal responsibility

image.altText: the premier looking stern at the camera

props.synopsis: Queensland's new LNP government has accused the former Labor administration of lying to the community about the cost and viability of a huge pumped hydro scheme which it has branded a "con job" and a "hoax".

title.children: Queensland government calls Labor's pumped hydro project a 'hoax' after true cost revealed

image.altText: A jockey urges his horse to the line in the Melbourne Cup as another horse runs on in the background.

props.synopsis: The Melbourne Cup has changed greatly in 30 years, but some things remain the same. Just ask three-time cup-winning jockey Kerrin McEvoy.

title.children: 'It's not irrevocable, but it is a real disadvantage': The evolving tactics of winning the Melbourne Cup

image.altText: A lady outside a melbourne suburban home

props.synopsis: As the Reserve Bank meets to consider whether to cut interest rates, housing affordability is again centre stage of the political debate. A federal inquiry is considering whether there's a need to ease restrictions on banks about how much they can lend out to first home buyers.

title.children: Home loans are hard to get. Now some politicians and banks want to change the rules

image.altText: A satellite circling the earth.

props.synopsis: A $7 billion plan to create an Australian military-grade satellite communications system announced in April last year has been cancelled as current defence spending is reviewed.

title.children: Major Australian military satellite project axed just 18 months after announcement

image.altText: James Van Der Beek revealed he has colorectal cancer, also known as bowel cancer.

props.synopsis: In a statement provided to US media outlet People magazine, the 47-year-old says he has been "privately dealing with this diagnosis".

title.children: Dawson's Creek star James Van Der Beek reveals colorectal cancer diagnosis

image.altText: A view of smaoke coming from volcano.

props.synopsis: At least ten people have died after Mount Lewotobi Laki-laki in eastern Indonesia erupts, spewing explosive plumes of lava and forcing authorities to evacuate several nearby villages, officials say.

title.children: Several people killed in Indonesian volcanic eruption

image.altText: A pod of pilot whales in the water with a medium-sized cruise vessel alongside them.

props.synopsis: Riley Grining was skippering a cruise around Tasmania's Macquarie Harbour on Sunday when he received a call to help stop a pod of pilot whales from stranding themselves on a beach.

title.children: 'It could have been way worse': Boats help shepherd whale pod out of Hells Gates to avoid mass stranding
